com.rwhitear.nimbleRest.volumes

Class OfflineVolume

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rwhitear.nimbleRest.volumes.OfflineVolume

  • public class OfflineVolume
extends java.lang.Object
    Take a Nimble array volume offline via its RESTful API.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    rwhitear@cisco.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • OfflineVolume

        public OfflineVolume(java.lang.String arrayIP,
                     java.lang.String token,
                     java.lang.String vol_id)
        Offline a Nimble array volume.
        Parameters:
        arrayIP - IP address of the target Nimble array.
        token - Authentication token retrieved earlier from the array for this session which needs to be set in an HTTP header called X-Auth-Token. Token retrieval can be achieved using the com.rwhitear.nimbleRest.authenticate.GetSessionToken class.
        vol_id - Nimble REST API volume ID for volume to be taken offline.

      • OfflineVolume

        public OfflineVolume(java.lang.String arrayIP,
                     int tcpPort,
                     java.lang.String token,
                     java.lang.String vol_id)
        Offline a Nimble array volume.
        Parameters:
        arrayIP - IP address of the target Nimble array.
        tcpPort - Destination Nimble array TCP port for RESTful API access (Defaults to 5392).
        token - Authentication token retrieved earlier from the array for this session which needs to be set in an HTTP header called X-Auth-Token. Token retrieval can be achieved using the com.rwhitear.nimbleRest.authenticate.GetSessionToken class.
        vol_id - Nimble REST API volume ID for volume to be taken offline.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute()
                         throws org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Execute a Nimble array volume offline operation via its RESTful API.
        Returns:
        The HTTP response received following the delete request.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpException - HTTP request execution exception.
        java.io.IOException - HTTP request execution exception.
